summary: This bill, the Providing Child Care for Police Officers Act of 2025, establishes a grant program managed by the Secretary of Health and Human Services to provide child care services for the children of law enforcement officers. The program aims to support officers' shift work and non-traditional hours, enhancing recruitment and retention. Grants are awarded to lead agencies, which then provide funds to covered entities for child care program establishment and operation. The bill includes matching requirements, specifies provider requirements, mandates audits and studies, and authorizes appropriations for fiscal years 2026-2030, with a termination date of September 30, 2030.
